text:
I have a portal with a _Default HubSpot subscription type_ thing. It's in english and true to the docs "*Please note:* if you've <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/account/how-do-i-turn-on-gdpr-functionality-in-my-HubSpot-account|enabled GDPR for your account>, you cannot edit the _Purpose of subscription_ or _Method of communication_ fields for default subscription types, such as the _Sales_ and _Services_ subscription types.", I cannot.

When I add a language variant of this subscription type, the _Purpose of subscription_ and _Method of communication_ fields are empty, and I cannot change them because they are set by HubSpot.

Also this leads me to understand that under GDPR this information is required, the tooltip says "under certain data protection laws" and a quick search didn't really tell me anything. It also leads me to believe that since they are set by HubSpot in English they should be in English.

The mind boggles

Also clicking on the "clear value" control for the values results in a javascript exception and a blank viewport

Also, any way to access the `languagePreference` (or anything in the query string) in system pages? I've been tasked to present the subscription preferences module in the language dictated in the e-mail but all I get out of `request.query`  is portal ID and e-mail.
